intro: Warrea tricolor var. unijugata, commonly known as the Three-color Warrea, is a rare and striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant, tri-colored leaves that display shades of red, yellow, and green, making it highly ornamental. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its distinctive, palmate leaf structure. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
